The B3 format refers to the ISO 216 B‑series sheet that measures 353 × 500 mm (13.9 × 19.7 in) and is commonly used for brochures, posters, art prints and magazine inserts; however, most office printers are built for A4 or Letter and may not accept B3 paper without a special feed tray[[1]](https://www.papersizeswiki.com/b3-paper-size/)[[6]](https://druku.lv/en/b0-b1-b2-b3-b4-b5-b6-b7-b8-paper-sizes/).  

If you need a portable printing solution that works with B3‑sized media, the Bentsai B3 handheld ink‑jet printer (model BT‑HH6105B3) is battery‑powered, can operate while charging, and connects via USB. It supports variable‑database printing (e.g., dates, QR codes, bar‑codes), prints in up to 600 DPI with a maximum image size of 4800 × 150 px, and can use both aqueous and fast‑drying solvent inks in colors such as black, white, red, yellow, blue, green and UV‑visible invisible ink. The device can mark a wide range of substrates—including paper, cardboard, wood, metal, plastic, fabric and flexible films—making it suitable for on‑site labeling, marking and small‑format graphic work[[2]](https://www.bentsaishop.com/FAQ-for-BENTSAI-B1-B2-B3-Handheld-Inkjet-Printers-Part-1)[[3]](https://arbizzi.it/prodotti/etichettatura-e-marcatura/marcatore-manuale-a-getto-dinchiostro-bentsai-b3/)[[17]](https://www.bentsaishop.com/Bentsai-Handheld-Printer-Comparison).
